Bundle Class

Source: R/S4classes.R, R/bundle.R, R/corpus.R
bundle.Rd

A bundle is used to combine several objects (partition, context, features, cooccurrences objects) into one S4 class object. Typically, a class inheriting from the bundle superclass will be used. When working with a context_bundle, a features_bundle, a cooccurrences_bundle, or a context_bundle, a similar set of standard methods is available to perform transformations.

# S4 method for bundle
name(x) <- value

# S4 method for bundle
length(x)

# S4 method for bundle
names(x)

# S4 method for bundle,vector
names(x) <- value

# S4 method for bundle
unique(x)

# S4 method for bundle,bundle
+(e1, e2)

# S4 method for bundle,textstat
+(e1, e2)

# S4 method for bundle
[[(x, i)

# S4 method for bundle
[[(x, i) <- value

# S4 method for bundle
$(x, name)

# S4 method for bundle
$(x, name) <- value

# S4 method for bundle
sample(x, size)

# S4 method for list
as.bundle(object, ...)

# S4 method for textstat
as.bundle(object)

# S3 method for bundle
as.data.table(x, col)

# S4 method for bundle
as.matrix(x, col)

# S4 method for bundle
subset(x, ...)

# S4 method for bundle
as.list(x)

# S3 method for bundle
as.list(x, ...)

# S4 method for bundle
get_corpus(x)

Arguments

x

a bundle object
value

character string with a name to be assigned
e1

object 1
e2

object 2
i

An integer value to index a bundle object.
name

The name of an object in the bundle object.
size

number of items to choose to generate a sample
object

A bundle object.
...

Further parameters
col

columns of the data.table to use to generate an object.

Slots

corpus

The CWB corpus the objects in the bundle are based on, a length 1 character vector.

objects

An object of class list.

p_attribute

Object of class character.

encoding

The encoding of the corpus.

Examples

parties <- s_attributes("GERMAPARLMINI", "party")
parties <- parties[-which(parties == "NA")]
party_bundle <- partition_bundle("GERMAPARLMINI", s_attribute = "party")
length(party_bundle)
#> [1] 6
names(party_bundle)
#> [1] "B90_DIE_GRUENEN" "CDU_CSU"         "DIE_LINKE"       "FDP"            
#> [5] "NA"              "SPD"            
get_corpus(party_bundle)
#> [1] "GERMAPARLMINI"
party_bundle <- enrich(party_bundle, p_attribute = "word")
summary(party_bundle)
#>              name  size p_attribute unique
#> 1 B90_DIE_GRUENEN 23052        word   4186
#> 2         CDU_CSU 66490        word   8486
#> 3       DIE_LINKE 22542        word   4531
#> 4             FDP 31505        word   4930
#> 5              NA 31310        word   5032
#> 6             SPD 47302        word   6692
parties_big <- party_bundle[[c("CDU_CSU", "SPD")]]
summary(parties_big)
#>      name  size p_attribute unique
#> 1 CDU_CSU 66490        word   8486
#> 2     SPD 47302        word   6692
p <- partition("GERMAPARLMINI", date = "2009-11-11")
#> ... get encoding: latin1
#> ... get cpos and strucs
pb <- partition_bundle(p, s_attribute = "party")
names(pb)
#> [1] "B90_DIE_GRUENEN" "CDU_CSU"         "DIE_LINKE"       "FDP"            
#> [5] "NA"              "SPD"            
pb[["NA"]] <- NULL
names(pb)
#> [1] "B90_DIE_GRUENEN" "CDU_CSU"         "DIE_LINKE"       "FDP"            
#> [5] "SPD"            
pb <- partition_bundle("GERMAPARLMINI", s_attribute = "party")
pb$SPD # access partition names "SPD" in partition_bundle pb
#> ** partition object **
#> corpus:              GERMAPARLMINI 
#> name:                SPD 
#> s-attributes:        party = SPD 
#> cpos:                908 pairs of corpus positions
#> size:                47302 tokens
#> count:               not available
pb <- partition_bundle("GERMAPARLMINI", s_attribute = "party")
pb$"NA" <- NULL # quotation needed if name is "NA"
use("polmineR")
#> ... activating corpus: GERMAPARLMINI (version: 0.0.1 | build date: 2019-02-23)
#> ... activating corpus: REUTERS
Ps <- partition_bundle(
  "REUTERS", s_attribute = "id",
  values = s_attributes("REUTERS", "id")
)
Cs <- cooccurrences(Ps, query = "oil", cqp = FALSE, verbose = FALSE, progress = TRUE)
#> Warning: No hits for query oil (returning NULL)
dt <- polmineR:::as.data.table.bundle(Cs, col = "ll")
m <- as.matrix(Cs, col = "ll")
